sub_title: Social Entrepreneur and Non-Profit Executive Leader
summary:
I am an innovative executive with over 30 years of leadership experience at both non-profit and for-profit organizations. I hold a deep understanding of both the local and international educational landscape. Using a high level of organizational and political savvy, I recruit volunteers, empower teams, and forge valuable partnerships. I am a culturally sensitive entrepreneur who draws on exceptional management, fundraising, and public speaking skills to drive organizational mission and vision. 

Key Accomplishments 

—Over the course of my career, directed hundreds of staff and volunteers, empowering teams to support quality education in underserved communities across the world.

—At Earthopia, negotiate, sustain, and close partnerships with district and school leaders, building innovation labs and makerspaces in public schools to support learning initiatives. 
—Established a teacher training program between India and Afghanistan, revolutionizing education standards in remote areas of Afghanistan and delivering a transformational experience for program members. 
—Helped Foundations raise $20M, allowing them to establish schools in 100k+ villages and instruct 2 million youths using modern technologies.

awards.title: Outstanding MA Sociology Student
awards.description: Awarded outstanding graduate student for my work.
awards.issuer: Department of Sociology and Anthropology GMU

awards.title: Presented and published
awards.description: Was chosen to present my work on education in rural India at ISA world conference.
awards.issuer: International Sociological Association (ISA) world conference in Vienna, Austria

profile_positions.description:
Nonprofit Management and Volunteer Recruiting: Recruit, coach, and direct over 20 local volunteers, as well as overseeing 10,000 team members in India, empowering teams to deliver quality education to underserved communities across the world.

Building Coalitions: Forge coalitions with diverse stakeholders; for example, partnered with the Finnish Ministry of Education and Culture to digitize their skill-building curriculum, subsequently distributing tablets to underprivileged youths. 

Cross-Organization Collaboration: Promote collaboration between private and public organizations (such as Google; Microsoft; Gates Foundation; USAID; Ekal Foundation; United Nations; and the World Bank), helping to deliver the latest education technologies. Collaborated with Ashoka.org and ativate1m1b.org to train fellows in social entrepreneurship skills in implementing their projects.

Assisted Design and Senior High School and Miami Dade College departments in procuring grants from Knights Foundation and Miami-Dade Department of Cultural Affairs.

Strategic Partnerships, Negotiation, and Public Schools: Negotiate, sustain, and close partnerships with district and school leaders, building innovation labs and makerspaces in public schools that support learning initiatives. 

Teacher Training: Established a teacher training program between India and Afghanistan, revolutionizing education standards in remote areas of Afghanistan and delivering a transformational experience for program members. Also collaborated with Finnish education experts to support the professional development of public school teachers in the United States, incorporating elements of the Finnish curriculum used by UNESCO to improve the teaching of entrepreneurship and 21st century skills. 

Digital Learning and Educational Leadership: Set up the first “smart village” in Jharkhand, India, bringing the village Internet connectivity, digital learning opportunities, and solar electricity.
profile_positions.title: President

profile_positions.description:
Team Leadership: Directed 500 staff in India, as well managing operations across the United States, Argentina, and the Philippines.

Infrastructure Management and Partnership-building: Set up and maintained the infrastructure for call centers between India and United States through multiple layers of management. This involved installing transnational communication lines for data and voice, as well as establishing partnerships with U.S. and Indian telecommunications companies. 

Training & Development: Established 100 training centers in India, providing underprivileged youth (ages 16–25) with the soft, technical, entrepreneurship, and 21st century skills needed to gain employment.

Call Center Administration and Relationship Building: Built and maintained the largest network of call centers/information communications technology (ICT) companies internationally, providing employment to over 10,000 youths across India. In addition, connected multi-national corporations to local Indian companies, helping companies to develop and implement improved processes across multiple industries. 

Telecommunications: Set up one of the first telecommunications hubs with Cisco switches, converting digital data to analog (and vice versa) to ensure efficient telecommunications/data communication across Network Group. 

Process Automation and Financial Process Improvement: Automated accounting and sales processes, resulting in improved financial management for a $1B network and an annual revenue of $10M.

Fundraising: Secured $4M from investors, obtaining the funds needed to build the organization’s infrastructure and business.
profile_positions.title: Senior Director Of Operations

profile_positions.description: Established Latin American markets for distribution of products (commodities automotive parts)from India and China. Logistic and supply chain management. Specialized in procurement from Chinese and Indian manufacturers to identify appropriate markets for their products in Latin/South America.
profile_positions.title: Director Of Business Development

volunteer_experiences.description: Working Jointly on raising over $20 million in bringing education to over 68,000 villages in India, impacting over 2 million children and their families.
VP PTA - I am in charge of setting up an Innovation Lab/Maker space in order to teach youth Entrepreneurship and other 21st century skills using current technologies.

•	Raised over $100k for student scholarships from government grants and public donors;
•	Implemented a CRM to manage and grow the membership.
•	Automated the communication system to keep members informed via email, text, and video/teleconference. 
•	Created an outreach program for community involvement, bringing various stakeholders (Community leaders, Parents, Administrators, Teachers and Students) together for the advancement of the PTA mission and vision. 
•	Promoted the goal of becoming a good citizen of Miami-Dade Community by encouraging students and parents to vote and become involved in local government. 
•	Organized and held successful Galas with over 500 prominent community leaders in attendance to raise awareness and funds for the school and community.
